TEXT: CARDINAL . On DATE , during a television broadcast , the head of ORG , PERSON , accused PERSON , the then Vice - President of ORG and President of CARDINAL of the political parties represented in ORG , of corruption and , together with a mafia gang , of protecting several companies allegedly involved in criminal activities . He stated , inter alia , that :

“ ... Mr PERSON should have been arrested as he has committed both a criminal offence and a minor administrative offence ... A criminal file concerning protecting criminals will be sent to ORG and to the court ... These companies [ which were suspected of being involved in criminal activities ] are being protected by the criminal gang headed by PERSON and by PERSON from ORG ... ”

CARDINAL . On DATE Flux published an article entitled “ The anti - corruption war : General N.A. versus President PERSON . PERSON claims that PERSON is providing political protection to a mafia clan . ”
CARDINAL . The article contained a word - by - word account of the televised broadcast of DATE and the newspaper 's commentary .

CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON brought a civil defamation action against ORG and argued that a large number of ORG 's statements published by ORG were untrue and defamatory of him . The title of the article was not among those statements .

CARDINAL . On DATE , by a final judgment , ORG found that the statements complained of by PERSON were not defamatory of him , inter alia , because ORG had simply reproduced ORG 's statements . However , it found that the following part of the article 's title was defamatory of PERSON : “ ORG claims that PERSON is providing political protection to a mafia clan ” . The court found that no such sentence had been pronounced by ORG during the broadcast of DATE and that the newspaper had not adduced evidence to prove that PERSON was a member of a mafia clan . The court ordered the newspaper to pay the plaintiff CARDINAL Moldovan Lei ( MDL ) and to issue an apology within DATE . The newspaper was also ordered to pay the court fees .
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of LAW in force at the material time read :

“ ( CARDINAL ) Any natural or legal person shall be entitled to apply to the courts to seek the withdrawal of statements which are damaging to his or her honour and dignity and do not correspond to reality , as well as statements which are not damaging to honour and dignity , but do not correspond to reality .

( CARDINAL ) When the media body which circulated such statements is not capable of proving that these statements correspond to reality , the court shall compel the publishing office of the media body to publish , not later then DATE after the entry into force of the judicial decision , a withdrawal of the statements in the same column , on the same page or in the same programme or series of broadcasts . ”

“ ( CARDINAL ) The moral damage caused to a person as a result of circulation through the mass media or by organisations or persons of statements which do not correspond to reality , as well as statements concerning his or her private or family life without his or her consent , shall be compensated by way of a pecuniary award . The amount of the award shall be determined by the court .

( CARDINAL ) The amount of the award shall be determined by the court in each case as an amount equal to DATE minimum wages if the information has been circulated by a legal person and DATE minimum wages if the information has been circulated by a natural person . ”
